borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="eop"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></span><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US">7. Bat and bird boxes</span></b></p><p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">(a)
Prior to above ground works details of bird nesting and bat roosting
bricks/boxes and all other habitat enhancements recommended in the hereby
approved ‘Preliminary Ecological Appraisal and Preliminary Roost Assessment’
(Applied Ecology Ltd – November 2021) have been submitted and approved in
writing by the Local Planning Authority. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">(b)
The approved details shall be installed prior to first occupation and
maintained thereafter.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal">







</p><p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">4. Site Contamination</span></b></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">No
development (with the exception of demolition works above ground level only)
shall commence until: <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">(b)&nbsp;&nbsp; a detailed remediation scheme, to bring the
site to a condition suitable for the intended use by removing unacceptable
risks to human health, buildings and other property and the natural and
historical environment, has been prepared and submitted to the Local Planning
Authority for approval in writing.&nbsp; The
scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives
and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures.&nbsp; The scheme must ensure that the site will not
qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act
1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">(c)&nbsp; The approved remediation scheme must be
carried out in accordance with its terms prior to commencement of the
development, other than that required to carry out remediation, unless
otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The Local Planning Authority must be given
two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Following
completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a
verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation
carried out must be produced and is subject to the approval in writing of the
Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The report
shall include results of sampling and monitoring carried out to demonstrate
that the site remediation criteria have been met. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">(d)&nbsp;&nbsp; In the event that contamination is found at
any time when carrying out the approved development that was not previously
identified it must be reported in writing immediately to the Local Planning
Authority.&nbsp; An investigation and risk
assessment must be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of (a), and
where remediation is necessary a remediation scheme must be prepared in
accordance with the requirements of (b), which is subject to the approval in
writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;
Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation
scheme a verification report must be prepared, which is subject to the approval
in writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">2. Approved Drawings and Documents<o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The development
hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following
approved plans and documents:<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><u><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Plans<b><span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></u></p><p class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">21018GA-D-001B
-Location Plan;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">21018GA-D-002E
-Site Plan;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">21018GA-D-006B
-Sections as proposed;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">21018GA-D-008-Refuse-D-008;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">21018GA-D-007A_bicycle
parking;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">21018GA-D-009A-Access
Plan-D-008;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">21018GA-D-003
-Location Plan with masterplan D-100;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">21018GA-D-005
-Elevations as proposed;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal"><u><span style="font-size:11.0pt">Documents</span></u><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;"><o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Cover
Letter, prepared by ROK Planning;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Design
and Access Statement (including landscaping details), prepared by Threesixty
Architecture;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Construction
Logistics Plan, prepared by Appian; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Energy
and Sustainability Statement, prepared by Atelier Ten; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Land
Contamination Assessment, prepared by Brownfield Solutions; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Transport
Assessment, prepared by Ardent; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Draft
Travel Plan, prepared by Ardent; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Drainage
Strategy (inc. SuDS and Drainage Assessment Form), prepared by Hydrock; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Noise
Impact Assessment, prepared by Ardent; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Air
Quality Assessment, prepared by Ardent; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Ecology
Desk Study, prepared by Applied Ecology; and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Fire
Statement, prepared by Sweco.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal">



























































</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt">No other drawings or
documents apply.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">22. Piling <o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span></p><p>



</p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">No
piling shall take place until a PILING METHOD STATEMENT (detailing the depth
and type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling
will be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimise the potential
for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the
works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning
authority in consultation with Thames Water.&nbsp; Any piling must be
undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method
statement.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">21. Delivery and Servicing
Plan  <o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal">

</p><p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Prior to first occupation in
accordance with Transport for London guidance the submission of a Delivery and
Servicing Plan shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning
Authority. Upon approval the Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be implemented
before commence of works and maintained thereafter.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">20. Soft
and Hard Landscaping<o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><b><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span></b></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">(a) Prior
to first occupation the hard and soft landscaping shown on hereby approved Design
and Access Statement (Three Sixty Architecture – November 2021) Section 3.9
‘Landscape Approach’ shall be carried out and thereafter permanently retained
for the duration of the development.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span></p><p>







</p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">(b) Any
plants which within a period of 5 years from first occupation which die, are
removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next
planting season with others of similar size and species unless the Local
Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><b><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">9.
Renewable Energy Infrastructure</span></b></span><span class="eop"><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></b></span><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span></span></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The
development hereby permitted will ensure the renewable energy infrastructure
will be carried out in accordance to document Energy Statement by XX dated YY
delivering a 35% reduction in site wide CO2 emissions, is implemented prior to
first occupation of the dwellings.</span></span><span class="eop"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></span><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><br></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">8.
Electric Vehicle Charging Points Details <o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">No
above ground new development shall take place until details of Electric Vehicle
Charging Points have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local
Planning Authority. The scheme shall demonstrate how active electric charging
points will be provided for 20% of the car parking spaces, with passive
provision for the remaining 80% of the spaces. The spaces shall be constructed
and marked out and the charging points installed prior to the occupation of the
development and thereafter retained permanently for the accommodation of
vehicles of occupiers and visitors to the premises and not used for any other
purpose.</span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:0cm;
margin-left:35.25pt;text-indent:-35.25pt;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><b><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">6.
Drainage Strategy</span></b></span><span class="eop"><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></b></span><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span></span></p><p>



</p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">No
development shall commence until a detailed drainage scheme (to include the
disposal of surface water by means of sustainable methods of urban drainage
systems) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning
Authority. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with such
approved details.</span></span><span class="eop"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></span><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><b><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">16.
External lighting</span></b></span><span class="eop"><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></b></span><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The
development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details showing the
provisions to be made for external lighting has been submitted to and approved
in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The lighting is to be designed,
installed and maintained&nbsp;so as to&nbsp;fully comply with The Association
of Chief Police Officers - Secured by Design publication "Lighting Against
Crime - A Guide for Crime Reduction Professionals", ACPO SPD, January
2011. The design shall satisfy criteria to limit obtrusive light presented in
Table 1, page 25 of the guide, relating to Environmental Zone E2 Low district
brightness areas-Rural, small village or relatively dark urban locations. The
development shall not be occupied until the approved scheme has been
implemented. Thereafter the approved measures shall be permanently retained
unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</span></span><span class="eop"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></span><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:0cm;
margin-left:35.25pt;text-indent:-35.25pt;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><b><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">15.
Crime Prevention Scheme</span></b></span><span class="eop"><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></b></span><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The
proposed development shall achieve a Certificate of Compliance in respect of
the Secured by Design scheme (silver), or alternatively achieve security
standards (based on Secured by Design principles) to the satisfaction of the
Metropolitan Police, details of which shall be provided to the Local Planning
Authority for its written approval prior to the first occupation of the
approved development. All security measures applied to the approved development
shall be permanently retained thereafter.</span></span><span class="eop"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></span><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">14.
Details of External Materials<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="vertical-align:baseline"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">Prior
to above ground works samples of materials to be used in the construction of
the external surfaces and all boundary treatments, their finish and any
resulting treatment of the development shall be submitted to and approved in
writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out
in accordance with the approved materials.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><b><span lang="EN-US">11. BREEAM</span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 11pt;">The development
hereby permitted shall achieve a BREEAM minimum ‘Excellent’ rating.
Certificated BREEAM Post Construction Review, or other verification process
agreed with the Local Planning Authority, shall be provided, confirming that
the agreed standards have been met, prior to the occupation of the approved
use.</span></p>

<p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><b><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">10.
Carbon Reduction</span></b></span><span class="eop"><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US">&nbsp;</span></b></span><b><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span></span></p><p class="paragraph" style="margin:0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span class="normaltextrun"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The
development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the
submitted Energy and Sustainability Statement prepared by Atelier Ten dated 02
December 2021 to achieve a minimum 35% reduction in carbon dioxide emissions
over Part L of the Building Regulations (2013) (when applying updated SAP 10
